complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: 1) Add routes for 6 modules using existing router; 2) Create placeholder components matching EMA blueprint; 3) Implement responsive design with 44px touch targets; 4) Add unit/e2e tests and tablet verification.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Straightforward UI task using existing routing framework. Multiple components (6 modules) increase effort but follow established patterns. Low technical risk, standard testing. Complexity from volume rather than novelty.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Expose Admin and Quality in Main Navigation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: 1) Update navigation component with new links and role checks using existing auth service; 2) Add role-based visibility tests and e2e access denial verification.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Simple nav update leveraging existing auth and page components. Minimal new code, low cyclomatic complexity. Dependency on task 13 is straightforward sequencing.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Define Module Access Controls and Roles
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) Define roles (clinician, admin, etc.); 2) Create permissions matrix config for 29 modules; 3) Integrate with navigation guards; 4) Unit test permission logic; 5) Integration tests for role-based module access.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: RBAC extension across 29 modules requires comprehensive matrix design and integration. High cognitive complexity from permission logic and testing coverage, but builds on existing system.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Create CRUD endpoints; 2) Implement FHIR R4 schema validation; 3) Add US Core search params (_id, patient, code, status); 4) Error handling with OperationOutcome; 5) Use base controller pattern; 6) Postman/FHIR validator tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: FHIR R4 compliance requires precise schema validation, search params, and error formats. Moderate complexity from spec adherence and testing, but single resource with established pattern reduces risk.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement CarePlan and CareTeam FHIR Resources
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split by resource: 1) CarePlan CRUD+search (patient, status, intent); 2) CareTeam CRUD+search; 3) FHIR R4 validation for both; 4) Validator tests, search coverage, pagination.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Two resources following task 16 pattern. Similar complexity to single resource but doubled volume. Standard search params increase validation surface area.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Group by complexity: 1) Code generation/schema setup; 2-6) Implement 5 simple resources (Coverage, Device, Goal, Location, RelatedPerson); 7-14) Implement 8 complex resources (DiagnosticReport, DocumentReference, etc.); 15) Conformance statements; 16) Testing suite.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: 13 resources create massive scope. Even with patterns/codegen, validation/testing matrix is high complexity. Risk of inconsistency across resources and dependency chain.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) $export endpoint with scope validation; 2) Job queue integration; 3) JobStatus polling endpoint; 4) NDJSON generation; 5) Manifest.json creation; 6) Async processing; 7) Integration tests with mock queue.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Complex async architecture with queueing, polling, file generation, and FHIR-specific formats. High integration complexity across multiple systems and strict spec compliance.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add FHIR OAuth Scopes and App Registration
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) Extend OAuth2 with FHIR SMART scopes; 2) Implement patient/provider/bulk flows; 3) Add /fhir/apps registration endpoint; 4) Consent management UI; 5) OAuth flow and UI tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Security-critical OAuth extension with healthcare-specific SMART scopes. Consent UI adds frontend complexity. High risk of security vulnerabilities.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Expand HL7 v2.x ADT and SIU Message Processing
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split by message type: 1) ADT (A01/A11/A13/A31) parsing+mapping; 2) SIU (S14/S17) parsing+mapping; 3) ACK/NACK generation with validation; 4) Pipeline integration and unit tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Multiple HL7 message types require precise parsing/mapping. HAPI library helps but domain knowledge and error handling add cognitive complexity.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement HL7 DFT P03 and ORM/ORU Processing
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) DFT^P03 charge posting; 2) ORM orders processing; 3) ORU results processing; 4) Domain mappings+DB transactions; 5) Error handling+NACKs with e2e tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Financial/orders/results processing involves complex domain mappings and transactions. Higher complexity than ADT/SIU due to business logic density.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add HL7 MLLP Listener and Reliability Features
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: 1) MLLP TCP listener (Netty/HAPI); 2) Configurable port setup; 3) Message queue integration (RabbitMQ/Kafka); 4) Retry policy with exponential backoff; 5) Dead-letter queue; 6) Load/reliability tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Distributed systems complexity with networking, queuing, retries, and reliability patterns. Load testing critical for healthcare messaging.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Phased approach: 1) Current schema assessment; 2) Migration cost-benefit analysis; 3) Dynamic schema switching in ORM; 4) Migration tooling development; 5) Data migration scripts; 6) Connection pooling updates; 7) Cross-tenant isolation tests; 8) Performance benchmarking.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Architectural migration with evaluation phase. High risk of data loss, performance degradation, cross-tenant leakage. Complex ORM changes and migration tooling.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Integrate Adaptive Learning UI in Clinical Workflows
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Suggestion panel component; 2) Integration with existing API endpoints; 3) Real-time updates (WebSocket/polling); 4) Dismiss/accept actions with component/integration tests.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: UI integration with real-time features. Clinical workflow context adds UX complexity but leverages existing APIs. Moderate real-time implementation challenge.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: 1) CSS framework updates (44px targets, iPad media queries); 2) Swipe gesture implementation (Hammer.js/native); 3) WCAG AA contrast audit and iPad testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: CSS/media query heavy task with gesture implementation. Manual device testing required. Follows accessibility best practices but broad surface area.
